datasources.name: origin_group
datasources.description: Use this data source to get information about a CDN origin group.

string.description: Name of the origin group.

list_nested.description: List of origin sources in the origin group.

string.description: IP address or domain name of the origin and the port, if custom port is used.

bool.description: Defines whether the origin is a backup, meaning that it will not be used until one of active origins become unavailable.
Enables or disables an origin source in the origin group.

string.description: The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.

bool.description: Defines whether to use the next origin from the origin group if origin responds with 4XX or 5XX codes.

datasources.name: shielding_pop
datasources.description: Use this data source to get ID of an available CDN origin shielding point of presence (PoP).

int64.description: ID of the origin shielding location.

string.description: Name of origin shielding location datacenter.
Country of origin shielding location.
City of origin shielding location.
The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.

datasources.name: shielding_pops
datasources.description: Use this data source to get list of available CDN origin shielding points of presence (PoPs).

string.description: ID of the resource.
The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.

list_nested.description: List of available origin shielding points of precense.

int64.description: ID of the origin shielding location.

string.description: Name of origin shielding location datacenter.
Country of origin shielding location.
City of origin shielding location.

datasources.name: ssl_certificate
datasources.description: Use this data source to get information about a CDN SSL certificate.

string.description: The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.
Name of the certification center issued the SSL certificate.
SSL certificate name.
Domain name that the SSL certificate secures.
Date when certificate become untrusted (ISO 8601/RFC 3339 format, UTC.).
Date when certificate become valid (ISO 8601/RFC 3339 format, UTC.).

resources.name: origin_group
resources.description: Manages a CDN origin group resource within VKCS.

string.description: The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new resource.
Name of the origin group.

list_nested.description: List of origin sources in the origin group.

string.description: IP address or domain name of the origin and the port, if custom port is used.

bool.description: Defines whether the origin is a backup, meaning that it will not be used until one of active origins become unavailable. Defaults to false.
Enables or disables an origin source in the origin group. Enabled by default.
Defines whether to use the next origin from the origin group if origin responds with 4XX or 5XX codes. Defaults to false.

resources.name: resource
resources.description: Manages a CDN resource within VKCS.

string.description: The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new resource.

bool.description: Enables or disables a CDN resource.

string.description: Delivery domain that will be used for content delivery through a CDN. Use `secondary_hostnames` to add extra domains. _note_ Delivery domains should be added to your DNS settings.

single_nested.description: Options that configure a CDN resource.
HTTP methods allowed for content requests from the CDN.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Compresses content with Brotli on the CDN side. CDN servers will request only uncompressed content from the origin.

set.description: List of content types to be compressed. It's required to specify text/html here.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description:
Cache settings for users browsers.
Cache expiration time is applied to the following response codes: 200, 201, 204, 206, 301, 302, 303, 304, 307, 308. Responses with other codes will not be cached.

string.description: Cache expiration time. Use '0s' to disable caching.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description:
Enables or disables CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) header support.
CORS header support allows the CDN to add the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header to a response to a browser.

list.description:
Value of the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header.
Possible values:
* ["*"] - adds "*" as the header value, content will be uploaded for requests from any domain.
*["domain.com", "second.dom.com"] - adds "$http_origin" as the header value if the origin matches one of the listed domains, content will be uploaded only for requests from the domains specified in the field.
* ["$http_origin"] - adds "$http_origin" as the header value, content will be uploaded for requests from any domain, and the domain from which the request was sent will be added to the header in the response.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

map.description:
A map representing the caching time for a response with a specific response code.
These settings have a higher priority than the value field.
* Use `any` key to specify caching time for all response codes.
* Use `0s` value to disable caching for a specific response code.

string.description: Enables content caching according to the origin cache settings.

Caching time. The value is applied to the following response codes: 200, 206, 301, 302.
Responses with codes 4xx, 5xx will not be cached. Use `0s` to disable caching.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

If enabled, CDN servers request and cache compressed content from the origin. The origin server should support compression. CDN servers will not decompress your content even if a user browser does not accept compression. Conflicts with `gzip_on` if both enabled simultaneously.

single_nested.description:
Allows to apply custom HTTP code to the CDN content.
Specify HTTP-code you need and text or URL if you're going to set up redirection.

string.description: URL for redirection or text.

bool.description: Controls the option state.
Forwards the Host header from a end-user request to an origin server. Conflicts with `host_header` if both enabled simultaneously.
Enables content compression using gzip on the CDN side. CDN servers will request only uncompressed content from the origin. Conflicts with `fetch_compressed` if both enabled simultaneously.

single_nested.description: Use this option to specify the Host header that CDN servers use when request content from an origin server. If the option is not set, the header value is equal to the first CNAME. Conflicts with `forward_host_header` if both enabled simultaneously.

string.description: Host Header value.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

Allows to specify how a file with different query strings is cached: either as one object (option is enabled) or as different objects (option is disabled.). `ignore_query_string`, `query_params_whitelist` and `query_params_blacklist` options cannot be enabled simultaneously.
Defines whether the files with the Set-Cookies header are cached as one file or as different ones.

single_nested.description: Use this option to specify query parameters, so files with these query strings will be cached as one object, and files with other parameters will be cached as different objects. `ignore_query_string`, `query_params_whitelist` and `query_params_blacklist` options cannot be enabled simultaneously.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Use this option to specify query parameters, so files with these query strings will be cached as different objects, and files with other parameters will be cached as one object. `ignore_query_string`, `query_params_whitelist` and `query_params_blacklist` options cannot be enabled simultaneously.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Use this option to control access to the content for specified countries.

list.description: List of countries according to ISO-3166-1. The meaning of the argument depends on `policy_type` value.

string.description: The type of CDN resource access policy. Must be one of following: "allow", "deny".

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Use this option to control access to the CDN resource content for specified domain names.

list.description: List of domain names or wildcard domains, without protocol. The meaning of the argument depends on `policy_type` value.

string.description: The type of CDN resource access policy. Must be one of following: "allow", "deny".

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: The option allows to control access to the CDN Resource content for specific IP addresses.

list.description: List of IP addresses with a subnet mask. The meaning of the argument depends on `policy_type` value.

string.description: The type of CDN resource access policy. Must be one of following: "allow", "deny".

bool.description: Controls the option state.
If enabled, CDN servers request and cache files larger than 10 MB in parts. Origins must support HTTP Range requests.

single_nested.description: If enabled, CDN serves stale cached content in case of origin unavailability.

list.description: The list of errors to which the option is applied.

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Custom HTTP Headers that a CDN server adds to a response.

map.description: A map of static headers in the format "header_name": "header_value".

bool.description: Controls the option state.

single_nested.description: Custom HTTP Headers for a CDN server to add to a request.

map.description: A map of static headers in the format "header_name": "header_value".

bool.description: Controls the option state.

int64.description: Origin group ID with which the CDN resource is associated.

string.description: Protocol used by CDN servers to request content from an origin source. If protocol is not specified, HTTP is used to connect to an origin server.

bool.description: Protocol used by CDN servers to request content from an origin source.

list.description: Additional delivery domains (CNAMEs) that will be used to deliver content via the CDN.

single_nested.description: Use this attribute to configure origin shielding.

int64.description: ID of the origin shielding point of presence.

bool.description: Defines whether origin shielding feature is enabled for the resource.

single_nested.description: SSL certificate settings for content delivery over HTTPS protocol.

string.description: Type of the SSL certificate. Must be one of following: "not_used", "own", "lets_encrypt".

int64.description: ID of the SSL certificate linked to the CDN resource. Must be configured when `type` is "own".

string.description: Status of the SSL certificate.
CDN resource status.

bool.description: Defines whether the CDN resource is integrated with the Streaming Platform.

resources.name: ssl_certificate
resources.description: Manages a CDN SSL certificate resource within VKCS.

string.description: The region in which to obtain the CDN client. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new resource.
Public part of the SSL certificate. All chain of the SSL certificate should be added.
Name of the certification center issued the SSL certificate.
Domain name that the SSL certificate secures.
SSL certificate name.
Private key of the SSL certificate.
Date when certificate become untrusted (ISO 8601/RFC 3339 format, UTC.).
Date when certificate become valid (ISO 8601/RFC 3339 format, UTC.).
